channel.title: The 26th Conference of the International Linear Algebra Society on ILAS2025
channel.description: Recent content in The 26th Conference of the International Linear Algebra Society on ILAS2025

item.title: Talks similarity dashboard
item.description:
Talks similarity dashboard

Talks Similarity Dashboard is an experimental web application that explores semantic relationships between academic talk titles and abstracts using natural language processing techniques. This project leverages large-scale language models and dimensionality reduction via t-SNE to map the textual content of talks into a two-dimensional interactive space. The closer two points are, the more similar their content is — enabling users to intuitively explore clustering tendencies, thematic overlaps, or outliers among submissions. While still a prototype, the project serves as a testbed for experimenting with embeddings, visualization strategies, and interaction design in the context of academic data exploration.

item.title: Schedule
item.description:
There will be Workshop Series on Bridging Abstract and Numerical Linear Algebra on June 22, Sunday, from 14:00 to 16:00 at SC4009-0 of the College of Science. You are welcome to join and work together on linear algebra education.

Early check-in is also availbale on June 22, Sunday, from 15:00 to 18:00 at the SC4009-1 of the College of Science.

One-page schedule
General information
Program

item.title: Notes
item.description:
Notes

所有$d$次以下的多項式可以形成一個向量空間$P_d$，其常用的基底為$\alpha=\{1,x,...,x^d\}$。 在這個基底的觀點，所有$P_d$中的多項式。

$$p(x)=c_0+c_1x+...+C_dx^d$$

都可以看成向量

Testing single dollar sign.

The function $f(x) = \frac{1}{x}$ is defined on the domain $X = \{1, 2, 3\}$.

Testing code from Mathematics in Markdown

This is an inline \(a^*=x-b^*\) equation.

These are block equations:

\[a^*=x-b^*\]\[ a^*=x-b^* \]\[ a^*=x-b^* \]

These are also block equations:

$$a^*=x-b^*$$$$ a^*=x-b^* $$$$ a^*=x-b^* $$

item.title: Contributed talks and posters
item.description:
The deadline for submitting a contributed talk or a poster is March 31.

Contributed talks

To submit a poster. Please visit the registration page to submit the abstract through Upload Abstract.

Within one week, you will receive an email of whether the contributed talk is approved.
After that, you may register the conference.

Posters

To submit a poster. Please email ilas2025 [at] math [dot] nsysu [dot] edu [dot] tw the following information:

item.title: Student support
item.description:
ILAS welcomes and encourages students to attend the ILAS conference. For this purpose, the society offers two types of support for PhD students.

  • Registration fee-waiver
  • Travel / accommodation support up to 700 USD

The students who would like to apply for one or both of them should fill in the application form before January 31.

Registration fee-waiver

Students can join ILAS for free and benefit from the reduced registration fee.

For students who are ILAS members, the basic registration fee is 1,700 NTD (approximately 55 USD). ILAS offers fee-waivers; to apply for one, please prepare

item.title: Social events
item.description:
Welcome reception

The reception will be held at the conference venue on Monday evening.
Taiwanese delicacies and beverage will be served to welcome the linear algbera community.

Price: included in the registration fee

Excursion

The excursion will be held on Wednesday afternoon. There are two options.

Option 1: Cruise tour in Kaoshiung Harbor (limited vacancies)

As the largest harbor in Taiwan, Kaohsiung Harbor serves as both an economic and cultural hub. In addition to its stunning tropical ocean views, the harbor is surrounded by a mix of modern and historic landmarks, such as the Kaohsiung Music Center, the 85 Sky Tower, the Cihou Lighthouse, and the British Consulate at Takow. This tour will begin with a viewing of the Great Harbor Bridge rotation show, followed by a cruise tour of Kaohsiung Harbor.

item.title: Mini-symposia and early career speakers
item.description:
Early career speakers

    Ryan O'Loughlin, Jani Virtanen, Ilya Spitkovsky
    Speakers
    • Dragana Cvetkovic Ilic, Similarities between the numerical range of an operator and of certain generalized inverses
    • Kennett Dela Rosa, Zero-dilation indices and numerical ranges
    • Ryan O'Loughlin, TBA
    • Brooke Randell, Exploring the numerical range of block Toeplitz operators
    • Jyoti Rani, On the generalizations of $q$-numerical range and radius
    • Jani A. Virtanen, TBA
  34. Combinatorics, association scheme, and graphs
    Wei-Hsuan Yu
    Speakers
    • Chia-En Chiang, TBA
    • Yen-chi Lin, Constructions of equiangular lines using lattices
    • Chia-An Liu, Spectral radius of bipartite graphs with prescribed number of edges
    • Wasin So, Formal orthogonal systems
    • Sho Suda, On $(2s-1)$-designs with $s$-distances in the Hamming association schemes
    • Wei-Liang Sun, Power difference sets and cyclotomic matrices
    • Pin-Chieh Tseng, Semidefinite programming bounds on the size of entanglement-assisted codeword stabilized quantum codes
  35. Preserver Problems, II
    Ngai-Ching Wong, Sushil Singla
    Speakers
    • Daisuke Hirota, Tingley's problem concerning the direct sum of extremely C-regular subspaces with the $\ell^p$-norm.
    • Bojan Kuzma, On bijections which strongly preserve Birkhoff-James orthogonality on finite-dimensional $C^*$-algebras
    • Izuho Matsuzaki, TBA
    • Lucijan Plevnik, Linear preservers of rank one projections
    • Manideepa Saha, On linear preservers of semimonotone matrices
    • Sushil Singla, Linear maps preserving product of involutions
    • Tamas Titkos, Isometries of Lipschitz free Banach spaces
    • Ming-Cheng Tsai, Multiplicative trace and spectrum preservers on nonnegative and stochastic matrices
    • Ya-Shu Wang, Linear maps preserving disjoint idempotents
    • Ngai-Ching Wong, Tingley's problems for positive spheres of operator algebras

Call for proposals

The ILAS2025 conference welcomes all topics related to linear algebra. Each mini-symposium will feature between 4 to 12 speakers, and each talk has 25 minutes, including the questions and discussion. If you are interested in organizing a mini-symposium at ILAS2025, please use the proposal template (tex pdf) to create your proposal and submit it through the form.

item.title: LOGO
item.description:
The conference LOGO is inspired by the Great Harbor Bridge, which is a landmark in Kaohsiung featuring its streamlined design. It is also the first bridge that can rotate horizontally to let boats pass through.

If the LOGO is viewed as a graph, then it is the graph with its graph6 string "G?}WNc" . It second smallest Laplacian eigenvalue is 1.6202543669426…

You may run the Sage code below

g = Graph("G?}WNc")
L = g.laplacian_matrix()
g.show()
show(L)
print(sorted(L.eigenvalues()))

or use SageCell to see the graph, the Laplacian matrix, and the eigenvalues.

item.title: Copyright
item.description:
The website was built by Jephian Lin using Hugo static site generators and Ananke theme.

The photos and images used in this website are from the following resources:

  • Courtesy of Yu-Ting Chen.
  • Courtesy of Jephian Lin.
  • Wikipedia.
  • Kaohsiung Travel.

item.title: Local
item.description:
Kaohsiung

Kaohsiung is a big city in southern Taiwan. It is located on the southwest coast and is one of Taiwan’s largest cities. Kaohsiung has a population of around 2.7 million people.

The city has a rich history with a former name Takow given by the indigenous people. It was originally a small fishing village many years ago. Over time, it grew into an important port city. Today, Kaohsiung is known for its busy harbor, which is one of the largest in the world.

item.title: Plan your trip
item.description:
Visa

Many countries are eligible for the Visa Exemption Program, with a duration of stay of up to 90 days.

In general, you may follow the instructions of the Bureau of Consular Affairs to apply for a visa.

Airport

Kaohsiung International Airport (KHH) is the closest airport to the conference venue. However, it has fewer international flights, often requiring a transfer at another major international airport hub in East Asia, such as HKG (Hong Kong), PVG (Shanghai), or NRT (Tokyo Narita).

item.title: Welcoming and Inclusiveness Statement
item.description:
The ILAS2025 organizing team will adhere to the Welcoming and Inclusiveness Statement of ILAS and make the conference an friendly environment for all.

Welcoming and Inclusiveness Statement

The International Linear Algebra Society (ILAS) is comprised of a diverse global membership.

It is the policy of ILAS to offer a welcoming and inclusive environment to all participants in its activities, including all its meetings and conferences, regardless of gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion or religious belief, age, marital status, disabilities, and field of expertise.
